title: Zaheer Khan:7 Facts You Should Be Knowing About Zaheer Khan, The Best Left-Arm Pacer India Has Ever Produced
text:
For the better part of the first decade of the 21st century, one man has shouldered India's pace attack like no other and that individual is Zaheer Khan. Zaheer was quick, could swing it and had variations which could deceive the best batsmen in the world. A terror to left-handers, deadly with both old and new ball and usually the one to take wickets in clusters, Zaheer is definitely the best left-arm pacer we have produced. In fact he is right up there with the likes of Wasim Akram when it comes to top southpaws with the ball. Now that is some elite company.

Cricinfo

Despite being plagued by injury, occasional lack of consistency and pulling out midway on tours, Zaheer did finish off with an impressive records in all forms of the game. The man was also handy with the bat and at one time held the highest Test score by a No. 11 batsman. He was no slouch on the field either and fielded in crucial positions like point and cover despite being our premier bowler. That rocket arm also came in handy for throwing the ball quickly. In other words, he was an asset we loved to have and certainly made good use of. Generally bowling 2 spells, Zaheer could dissect the opponent's batting systematically. However, behind the cricketer is the man. So let's find out something about him off the field, after all cricket is just part of life, not life itself. Here we go:

1. Was born in Srirampur, which is 40km from Shirdi

2. Father was a photographer while mother taught in a school

Don't Miss 178 SHARES 109 SHARES

3. He is fondly called Zak by his teammates though during his country stint he was known as Zippy Zakky on account of his good deliveries

4. In cricket he idolises Sachin Tendulkar while outside the sport his inspiration is Roger Federer

5. He owns a restaurant in Pune called ZK’s which is managed by his younger brother Anees

6. Is married to actress Sagarika Ghatge who is famous for her role in Chak De! India. The couple tied the knot in 2017.

7. As a boy, he was scared of flying and once even asked his coach Vidyadhar Paradkar to accompany him when going by plane to Madhya Pradesh with the Ranji probables
